commit_message:
Archive instance_actions and instance_actions_event

This try to handle the soft-delete of instance_actions and
instance_actions_event before the archive of deleted rows. So in
this way theses tables will be archived like others.

Change-Id: Ia0fe130a35a6c9bb16a940f3f4cea6b1aaee9668
Partial-Bug: #1183523
(cherry picked from commit 59439059ed818eb8476a8c61683a02770fe9f821)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/30/326730/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(clecomte): Tables instance_actions and instances_actions_events # have to be manage differently so we soft-delete them here to let # the archive work the same for all tables if tablename == "instance_actions": instances = models.BASE.metadata.tables["instances"] deleted_instances = sql.select([instances.c.uuid]).\ where(instances.c.deleted != instances.c.deleted.default.arg) update_statement = table.update().values(deleted=table.c.id).\ where(table.c.instance_uuid.in_(deleted_instances)) conn.execute(update_statement) elif tablename == "instance_actions_events": # NOTE(clecomte): we have to grab all the relation from # instances because instance_actions_events rely on # action_id and not uuid instances = models.BASE.metadata.tables["instances"] instance_actions = models.BASE.metadata.tables["instance_actions"] deleted_instances = sql.select([instances.c.uuid]).\ where(instances.c.deleted != instances.c.deleted.default.arg) deleted_actions = sql.select([instance_actions.c.id]).\ where(instance_actions.c.instance_uuid.in_(deleted_instances)) update_statement = table.update().values(deleted=table.c.id).\ where(table.c.action_id.in_(deleted_actions)) conn.execute(update_statement)

The FakeNetworkAPI was setting the _vlan_is_disabled class member to
False and there was no override of that member anywhere else in the
code. It was checked in one place to determine whether or not to raise a

Change-Id: I830bf1e5c62ec842701fed48b6ecc9ddf7deb2ba
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused _vlan_is_disabled test flag

The FakeNetworkAPI was setting the _vlan_is_disabled class member to
False and there was no override of that member anywhere else in the
code. It was checked in one place to determine whether or not to raise a
NotImplementedError. But since it was never True that was never raised.

Change-Id: I830bf1e5c62ec842701fed48b6ecc9ddf7deb2ba

commit_message:
Trivial: No need to exclude TestMoveClaim from py34 tests

The unit test nova.tests.unit.compute.test_tracker.TestMoveClaim doesn't need
to be excluded from py34 testing.  Both tox py27 and py34 can successfully
test it without any changes.

Change-Id: I5915b5df41d90bb3074baa7a4fa38d231910c72c
Partially-Implements: blueprint nova-python3-mitaka

commit_message:
Fix use of invalid assert calls

assert_called_once and assert_called are not part of the mock
API; rework assertions to perform the same validation using
appropriate methods.

Change-Id: I8212a8d6aea4d4db1d0441088828a6602e6c0957

commit_message:
Nova UTs broken due to modifying loopingcall global var

In unit tests, this practice that we just replace a method/class with
the Mock directly would break other tests, like the following:
    loopingcall.FixedIntervalLoopingCall = mock.Mock()

We should use mock.patch() instead of the assignment with mock.Mock.

Change-Id: Id6f0ee53fc7ecf452fa8c015e26e4d59e716a10d
Closes-Bug: #1584762
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/16/319916/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

successfully. Update support matrix accordingly.

deleted_lines: def get_cache_fname(image_id): """Return a filename based on the SHA1 hash of a given image ID. Image files stored in the _base directory that match this pattern return hashlib.sha1(image_id).hexdigest()

commit_message:
virt: set address space & CPU time limits when running qemu-img

This uses the new 'prlimit' parameter for oslo.concurrency execute
method, to set an address space limit of 1GB and CPU time limit
of 2 seconds, when running qemu-img.

This is a re-implementation of the previously reverted commit

commit da217205f53f9a38a573fb151898fbbeae41021d
Author: Tristan Cacqueray <tdecacqu@redhat.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 5 17:17:04 2015 +0000

    virt: Use preexec_fn to ulimit qemu-img info call

Closes-Bug: #1449062
Change-Id: I135b5242af1bfdcb0ea09a6fcda21fc03a6fbe7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/63/307663/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import resourcefrom oslo_utils import unitsQEMU_IMG_LIMITS = processutils.ProcessLimits( address_space=1 * units.Gi) out, err = utils.execute(*cmd, prlimit=QEMU_IMG_LIMITS)

subject: Enable mutable config in Nova
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-16 18:02:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9f5831deec86d44238b4585cc6d0ee871f8a503e', 'message': "Make 'debug' option reconfigurable in Nova

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
This is only respected when the new method mutate_config_files is
called instead of reload_config_files. Nova delegates making this call
to oslo.service, so how do we switch?
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e allows services to tell
oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be called by passing a
parameter, which this patch does.

This allows Nova to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. IE when all these patches merge,
we should be able to turn debug logging on and off by changing the
config and sending SIGHUP.

Further patches will make selected Nova options mutable.

Change-Id: I8f09f9482736b496e3ad7117f170e476e92c2b7d

commit_message:
Enable mutable config in Nova

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
This is only respected when the new method mutate_config_files is
called instead of reload_config_files. Nova delegates making this call
to oslo.service, so how do we switch?
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e allows services to tell
oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be called by passing a
parameter, which this patch does.

This allows Nova to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. IE when all these patches merge,
we should be able to turn debug logging on and off by changing the
config and sending SIGHUP.

Further patches will make selected Nova options mutable.

Part of bp:mutable-config

Change-Id: I8f09f9482736b496e3ad7117f170e476e92c2b7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/51/280851/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return service.ProcessLauncher(CONF, restart_method='mutate')

subject: Remove policy checkpoints for SecurityGroupAPI and NetworkAPI
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-05 09:41:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ebe66a7ad4520ef85fa380ffe3dc5e5f55b61384', 'message': 'Remove policy checkpoints for SecurityGroupAPI and NetworkAPI

As legacy v2 API removed and v2.1 API check policy at API layer,
those policy checks under API layer are useless. This patch
cleanup them.

commit_message:
Remove policy checkpoints for SecurityGroupAPI and NetworkAPI

As legacy v2 API removed and v2.1 API check policy at API layer,
those policy checks under API layer are useless. This patch
cleanup them.

Partially implements blueprint remove-legacy-v2-api-code

Change-Id: Id64892e5837a61fa04437c79df01c23e5e1a9b25
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/41/325641/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def policy_decorator(scope): """Check corresponding policy prior of wrapped method to execution.""" def outer(func): @functools.wraps(func) def wrapped(self, context, target, *args, **kwargs): if not self.skip_policy_check: check_policy(context, func.__name__, target, scope) return func(self, context, target, *args, **kwargs) return wrapped return outer wrap_check_security_groups_policy = policy_decorator( scope='compute:security_groups') def check_policy(context, action, target, scope='compute'): _action = '%s:%s' % (scope, action) nova.policy.enforce(context, _action, target) @wrap_check_security_groups_policy @wrap_check_security_groups_policy

commit_message:
Provide default service_name for keystone endpoint

This change updates the neutron::keystone::auth class to include a
default service_name of 'neutron' so that if a user changes the
auth_name, the service is still created as being related to
'neutron'.

Closes-bug: #1590040
Change-Id: I3b23ad48a2b080ee32b333b81dcfe7f2369ee2e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/36/326836/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Name of the service. Defaults 'neutron'. $service_name = 'neutron', if $configure_endpoint { Keystone_endpoint["${region}/${service_name}::${service_type}"] ~> Service <| title == 'neutron-server' |> keystone::resource::service_identity { 'neutron': service_name => $service_name, auth_name => $auth_name,
deleted_lines: # Name of the service. Defaults to the value of auth_name. $service_name = undef, $real_service_name = pick($service_name, $auth_name) if $configure_endpoint { Keystone_endpoint["${region}/${real_service_name}::${service_type}"] ~> Service <| title == 'neutron-server' |> keystone::resource::service_identity { $auth_name: service_name => $real_service_name,

subject: Do not print unhandled exception if in production
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-08 18:57:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/604863aa126eddb5a3c7cb61b0c89b50980a296b', 'message': 'Catch any uncaught exceptions in base handler

We should never have any uncaught exceptions but if we do we need to
catch the acception, log the error and return back a generic 500. This

Change-Id: I820f5682d0fac292722a9f205965516771333a4d
Closes-Bug: #1585160

This change removes the printing of unhandled exceptions when not in
development mode. We should never return the unhandled exception
information when not in development mode.

Change-Id: I820f5682d0fac292722a9f205965516771333a4d
Closes-Bug: #1585160
'}]
commit_message:
Do not print unhandled exception if in production

This change removes the printing of unhandled exceptions when not in
development mode. We should never return the unhandled exception
information when not in development mode.

Change-Id: I820f5682d0fac292722a9f205965516771333a4d
Closes-Bug: #1585160

Change-Id: I82c9c04b1690cf3c4aaa35ae2f71c4269b21d946

commit_message:
Use method is_valid_ipv4 from oslo.utils

In module netaddr valid_ipv4 raise exception AddrFormatError
if address is specified as empty string. Method is_valid_ipv4
catches the exception and returns boolean value. So we'd better
use it from oslo.utils.

Change-Id: I82c9c04b1690cf3c4aaa35ae2f71c4269b21d946
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/33/327533/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import netutils return netutils.is_valid_ipv4(ip_address) elif int(ip_version) == 6: return netutils.is_valid_ipv6(ip_address)
deleted_lines: return netaddr.valid_ipv4(ip_address) elif int(ip_version) == 6: return netaddr.valid_ipv6(ip_address)

commit_message:
Puppet4 support: refactor vips

The generate_vips function is refactored to work in pair
with the create_resources functions. It's much better for testing
and debugging.
Input data of the vurual ip definition is split into many parameters
and the generate vips function is tought to support the changed
interfacs as well as to work with Puppet4's undef values.

Change-Id: If865f39a3d1c22efa6df8035a4e92004fcf2ffb6
Related-Bug: 1586480

commit_message:
Add basic schema support for profile operations

This patch adds basic support for schema operations. Some experimental
oeprations are added to profiles as starters. More operations can be
added later.

Change-Id: Ia54d7dd81f82c6e252f6a969167447c40265d426

commit_message:
Don't hard code subnet

Replace hard coded private-subnet with configurable heat subnet for
lbaasv2 functional test.

commit_message:
Fix public gateway mac handling

Closes-bug: #1585091
Co-Authored-By: omer.anson@toganetworks.com

Change-Id: I1395d8443a29998105c7109f337ed5abd88a3f1d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/12/326912/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from dragonflow._i18n import _from neutron.agent.ovsdb.native import idlutils self.local_floatingips = collections.defaultdict(str) self._init_external_network_bridge_check() def _check_for_external_network_bridge_mac(self): idl = self.vswitch_api.idl if not idl: return interface = idlutils.row_by_value( idl, 'Interface', 'name', self.external_network_bridge, None, ) if not interface: return if not interface.mac_in_use[0]: return if interface.mac_in_use[0] == '00:00:00:00:00:00': return return interface.mac_in_use[0] def _wait_for_external_network_bridge_mac(self): mac = self._check_for_external_network_bridge_mac() if not mac: return for key, floatingip in six.iteritems(self.local_floatingips): self._install_dnat_egress_rules(floatingip, mac) raise loopingcall.LoopingCallDone() def _init_external_network_bridge_check(self): """Spawn a thread to check that br-ex is ready.""" self._wait_for_external_network_bridge_mac) def _install_dnat_egress_rules(self, floatingip, network_bridge_mac): parser.OFPActionSetField(eth_dst=network_bridge_mac), parser.OFPActionOutput(port=self.external_ofport)] mac = self._check_for_external_network_bridge_mac() if mac: self._install_dnat_egress_rules(floatingip, mac) self.local_floatingips[floatingip.get_id()] = floatingip self.local_floatingips.pop(floatingip.get_id(), 0)
deleted_lines: from dragonflow._i18n import _, _LEfrom ryu.lib.packet import packet self.external_gateway_mac = collections.defaultdict(str) self.api.register_table_handler(const.INGRESS_NAT_TABLE, self.packet_in_handler) self._periodic_send_arp_request() def _get_external_gateway_mac(self, net_id): return self.external_gateway_mac[net_id] def _set_external_gateway_mac(self, net_id, gw_mac): self.external_gateway_mac[net_id] = gw_mac def _send_arp_request_entry(self): """Sending the arp request at the configured interval.""" for net_id, gw_mac in six.iteritems(self.external_gateway_mac): fip = None # if gw mac is none, then need to get it if gw_mac is None: fip = self.db_store.get_first_floatingip(net_id) if fip: # request gw arp self._send_gw_arp_request(fip) def _periodic_send_arp_request(self): """Spawn a thread to periodically check the external gateway.""" self._send_arp_request_entry) def _update_external_gateway_mac(self, fips, learning_mac): net_id = fips[0].get_floating_network_id() gw_mac = self._get_external_gateway_mac(net_id) if not gw_mac or gw_mac != learning_mac: self._set_external_gateway_mac(net_id, learning_mac) for fip in fips: if fip.get_status() == FIP_GW_RESOLVING_STATUS: self._install_dnat_egress_rules(fip) def packet_in_handler(self, event): msg = event.msg pkt = packet.Packet(msg.data) arp_pkt = pkt.get_protocol(arp.arp) if arp_pkt is None: LOG.error(_LE("No support for non ARP protocol")) return if (arp_pkt.opcode == arp.ARP_REQUEST and arp_pkt.src_ip == arp_pkt.dst_ip or arp_pkt.opcode == arp.ARP_REPLY): # learn gw mac from fip arp reply packet # or update gw mac from fip gateway gratuitous arp gw_fips = self.db_store.get_floatingips_by_gateway(arp_pkt.src_ip) if not gw_fips: return self._update_external_gateway_mac(gw_fips, arp_pkt.src_mac) def _send_gw_arp_request(self, fip): # TODO(Fei Rao)check the network type, snd the packet to external # gateway port self.send_arp_request(fip.get_mac_address(), fip.get_ip_address(), fip.get_external_gateway_ip(), self.external_ofport) def _get_match_gratuitous_arp(self, destination_ip, network_id=None): request_ip = utils.ipv4_text_to_int(str(destination_ip)) parser = self.get_datapath().ofproto_parser match = parser.OFPMatch() match.set_dl_type(ether.ETH_TYPE_ARP) match.set_arp_spa(request_ip) match.set_arp_tpa(request_ip) match.set_arp_opcode(arp.ARP_REQUEST) if network_id is not None: match.set_metadata(network_id) return match def _get_instructions_packet_in(self): parser = self.get_datapath().ofproto_parser ofproto = self.get_datapath().ofproto actions = [parser.OFPActionOutput(ofproto.OFPP_CONTROLLER, ofproto.OFPCML_NO_BUFFER)] inst = [self.get_datapath().ofproto_parser.OFPInstructionActions( ofproto.OFPIT_APPLY_ACTIONS, actions)] return inst def _install_mac_learning_rules(self, floatingip, ignore=False): # process arp reply match = self._get_match_arp_reply( floatingip.get_ip_address(), floatingip.get_external_gateway_ip()) instructions = self._get_instructions_packet_in() self.mod_flow( self.get_datapath(), inst=instructions, table_id=const.INGRESS_NAT_TABLE, priority=const.PRIORITY_MEDIUM, match=match) network_id = floatingip.get_floating_network_id() if ignore or self._get_external_network_count(network_id) <= 0: # if it is the first floatingip for this external gateway, # install a gateway mac learning rules # process gratuitous arp match = self._get_match_gratuitous_arp( floatingip.get_external_gateway_ip()) self.mod_flow( self.get_datapath(), inst=instructions, table_id=const.INGRESS_NAT_TABLE, priority=const.PRIORITY_MEDIUM, match=match) def _remove_mac_learning_rules(self, floatingip, ignore=False): ofproto = self.get_datapath().ofproto # remove arp reply rules match = self._get_match_arp_reply( floatingip.get_ip_address(), floatingip.get_external_gateway_ip()) self.mod_flow( self.get_datapath(), command=ofproto.OFPFC_DELETE, table_id=const.INGRESS_NAT_TABLE, priority=const.PRIORITY_MEDIUM, match=match) network_id = floatingip.get_floating_network_id() if ignore or self._get_external_network_count(network_id) <= 1: # if it is the last flaotingip for this external gateway, # remove a gateway mac learning rules. # remove gratuitous arp rules match = self._get_match_gratuitous_arp( floatingip.get_external_gateway_ip()) self.mod_flow( self.get_datapath(), command=ofproto.OFPFC_DELETE, table_id=const.INGRESS_NAT_TABLE, priority=const.PRIORITY_MEDIUM, match=match) def _install_dnat_egress_rules(self, floatingip): net_id = floatingip.get_floating_network_id() gw_mac = self._get_external_gateway_mac(net_id) if not gw_mac: # Record the resolving gw arp self._set_external_gateway_mac(net_id, None) self._send_gw_arp_request(floatingip) floatingip.update_fip_status(FIP_GW_RESOLVING_STATUS) return parser.OFPActionSetField(eth_dst=gw_mac), parser.OFPActionDecNwTtl(), parser.OFPActionOutput(self.external_ofport, 0)] self._install_dnat_egress_rules(floatingip) self._install_mac_learning_rules(floatingip) # gw ip changed, so need to resolve the gw arp again fip.update_fip_status(FIP_GW_RESOLVING_STATUS) self.update_floatingip_gateway(fip, old_fip) fip, old_fip = fip_groups[0] self._set_external_gateway_mac(fip.get_floating_network_id(), None) self._send_gw_arp_request(fip) def update_floatingip_gateway(self, fip, old_fip): self._install_mac_learning_rules(fip, True) self._remove_mac_learning_rules(old_fip, True) # gw mac maybe change self._remove_dnat_egress_rules(fip)

subject: On update router transfer the router ports info
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-08 08:31:18.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/db/api_nb.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow/commit/cc23d11c98b36886822817b6b21af6ac73286f66', 'message': 'On update router transfer the router ports info

We did not copy the ports data when the router object was updated.
This is a quick fix, the router ports need to move to a
separate table for better performance and managment

Change-Id: Id141a1ebe728a855b7814ddb987dc377bc802584
'}]
commit_message:
On update router transfer the router ports info

We did not copy the ports data when the router object was updated.
This is a quick fix, the router ports need to move to a
separate table for better performance and managment

Change-Id: Id141a1ebe728a855b7814ddb987dc377bc802584

security group update fix

We did not preserve the values that we did not
change in the object

Change-Id: I82a39913365de1e09d3c89c7669402c848ea64e3

commit_message:
Add name and generation to ResourceProvider object

Add 'name' and 'generation' to the ResourceProvider object so that the
humane name and generation counter associated with the provider can be
persisted and used in display.

Change-Id: I5bc19065fdd2bbbeec67908f3feabbd43a492c89
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

commit_message:
DF allways consider the lroutre as distributed

In the Neutron API for Virtual Router they have support for backward
comparability with non distributed routers
We should ignore the Boolean parameter in the router create,
No need to add this value to the DF router data module

The SNAT is handled in the df_l3_service

Change-Id: I53937e4d2bdddbc095e020acfdd1c5ffbf3f27be
Closes-bug:#1586995

commit_message:
Remove type=timestamp usages

This change removes the UNIXEpoch and ISO8601 Format classes from
openstack.format as well as all of their usages in Resource classes and
their tests. Additionally, this removes the need to depend on oslo.utils
and iso8601.

Change-Id: I617fb9f0739490a3401f14a654e30b33a476ca59

commit_message:
Increase wait timeout for the check of finished provisioning

5s can be not enough to wait for provisioning progress bar disappears.
5s timeout increased to 10s.

Change-Id: Iabdae218a7702fbe7fa007f6466cd38effa15ef0

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-26 21:20:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa/commit/d46619db755c9d4011a0aec51e86276b92d0b129', 'message': "Fix UCA package check function

This change fixes the dpkg-query parameters that get passed. The
\n was being interpreted as an actual line break rather than
being passed to the command line as a \n.  dpkg-query accepts the string
'\n' in the format to ensure the output has a line return in it. Because
the previous version was actually being interpreted as a line break, it
was causing errors in the ssh command when it was executed on the remote
system.

'\n' in the format to ensure the output has a line return in it. Because

Change-Id: I1955e8809f851f8602991def6bb3fdad63cd6693
Closes-Bug: #1586170
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-27 15:50:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa/commit/a5092b4a47afb27bbf181304b0f416ad7202a16c', 'message': "Fix UCA package check function

This change fixes the dpkg-query parameters that get passed. The
\n was being interpreted as an actual line break rather than
being passed to the command line as a \n.  dpkg-query accepts the string
'\n' in the format to ensure the output has a line return in it. Because
the previous version was actually being interpreted as a line break, it
was causing errors in the ssh command when it was executed on the remote
system.

Additionally this adjust the origin check to only check for the UCA uri
as the package may come from proposed or main.

Change-Id: I1955e8809f851f8602991def6bb3fdad63cd6693
Closes-Bug: #1586170
"}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2016-05-27 18:25:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa/commit/ba74e2bb6ff002ce0bbf9fc83046ab0cc6b2511e', 'message': "Fix UCA package check function

This change fixes the dpkg-query parameters that get passed. The
\n was being interpreted as an actual line break rather than
being passed to the command line as a \n.  dpkg-query accepts the string
'\n' in the format to ensure the output has a line return in it. Because
the previous version was actually being interpreted as a line break, it
was causing errors in the ssh command when it was executed on the remote
system.

Additionally this adjust the origin check to only check for the UCA uri
as the package may come from proposed or main.

Change-Id: I1955e8809f851f8602991def6bb3fdad63cd6693
Closes-Bug: #1586170
"}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2016-05-27 22:21:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa/commit/605ddee05c0efc8b037e0a8294d072ab5ccd0b8a', 'message': "Fix UCA tests

This change includes several string escaping fixes for the commands
used to check the source of the OpenStack packages.

This change fixes the dpkg-query parameters that get passed. The
'\n' was being interpreted as an actual line break rather than
being passed to the command line as '\n'.  dpkg-query accepts the string
'\n' in the format to ensure the output has a line return in it. Because
the previous version was actually being interpreted as a line break, it
was causing errors in the ssh command when it was executed on the remote
system.  Additionally this adjust the origin check to only check for the
UCA uri as the package may come from proposed or main.

Also included in this patch is the exclusion of using the glance
packages for checks as the murano-glance-artifacts-plugin package
is currently installed by Fuel but is a MOS specific package.

Change-Id: I1955e8809f851f8602991def6bb3fdad63cd6693
Closes-Bug: #1586170
"}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2016-06-06 16:02:04.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/tests_uca/test_uca.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa/commit/bc62f7bfe6ddeda19859b43cb7f9d4e73b5fad39', 'message': 'Fix UCA tests

commit_message:
Fix UCA tests

This change fixes the check for package origin to only check the UCA
repository as packages may be in main or updates.

Change-Id: I1955e8809f851f8602991def6bb3fdad63cd6693
Closes-Bug: #1586170

commit_message:
Pass ha_router_port flag for _snat_router_interfaces ports

Currently, router_centralized_snat port can be bound to a host were
l3-agent is in standby state (L3 HA + DVR case). As a result VM without
floating ip is unable to reach external network. This change passes
ha_router_port flag to _ensure_host_set_on_port when called for
_snat_router_interfaces ports.

Note: this issue is intermittent, without changes in l3_rpc.py
unit test does not fail every time.

Co-Authored-By: Oleg Bondarev <obondarev@mirantis.com>

Closes-bug: #1582739
Change-Id: I74bad578361ed7eac8cc6c740b06b66ab1530cd5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/41/317541/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Expose mempages via API

Expose the number, type and affinity of memory pages available, as
currently stored in the database, via the API.

Change-Id: I0c7e549442b674ddde6eb6518170092fa2b6a506
Blueprint: hugepages-api
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/28/305728/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================== Expose hugepage information via REST API ======================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/hugepages-api Expose the number, type and affinity of hugepages available, as currently stored in the database, via the API. Problem description =================== Nova currently exposes both simple host resources, like number of CPUs or amount of RAM, with more detailed host resources such as PCI devices or NUMA topologies, via its API. However, hugepages, incredibly important for high performance applications like Virtual Network Functions (VNFs), are not exposed. As things stand, the only way for users and/or applications to query the status of those resources is by accessing the Nova database(s) directly. This information is not currently accessible through the API. Hugepages can come in many sizes, 2048kB and 1GB on x86 platforms, and, like memory in general, are affinitized to individual nodes in a NUMA-based platform. Both the sizes of available hugepages and the per-node affinity of these should be exposed. A future work item could be to expose hugepages as a resource, per the resource-classes blueprint. Use Cases --------- As an administrator, I want to view available hugepage resource on a given hupervisor, so I can determine the number of instances I can theoretically boot. 1. User issues ```nova hypervisor-show``` or ```nova hypervisor-list``` command 2. System retrieves the hypervisor information from the database 3. System outputs the list of the devices to CLI, web UI or management application. The description in the list consists of the following: * Hugepages available per NUMA node * Hugepages used per NUMA node * Hugepages total per NUMA node As an administrator, I want to view hugepages associated with instances, so I can determine which instances are using which resources. 1. User issues ```nova show``` or ```nova list``` command 2. System retrieves the instance information from the database 3. System outputs the list of the devices to CLI, web UI or management application. The description in the list consists of the following: * Hugepages assigned per NUMA node As an administrator, I want to view available hugepage resources on all available hypervisors, so I can track this as part of an inventory managment system. Proposed change =============== The data for this change already exists in the database(s). This change will simply expose that via this information as additional fields in existing API endpoints. Alternatives ------------ Users could continue to query the database directly to retrieve this information. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- This proposal would add a API microversion for retrieving hugepage information for both hosts and instance. A list of hugepages for the specified hypervisor is returned along with the hypervisor's detailed information :: GET /os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id} Response :: { "id": {hypervisor_id}, ... other hypervisor resource properties ... "hugepages_total": [ { "node": 0, "size": "2M", "total": 1024, "avail": 512 }, { "node": 0, "size": "1G", "total": 2, "avail": 2 }, { "node": 1, "size": "2M", "total": 512, "avail": 0 } ] } If there are no available hugepages, no error is raised and an empty list is returned instead. A list of hugepages assigned to the given instance is returned along with the instance's detailed information :: GET /servers/{server_id} Response :: { "server": { "id": {server_id}, ... other server resource properties ... "os-hugepages:hugepages": [ { "node": 0, "size": "2M", "total": 512, } ] } } If there are no attached hugepages, no error is raised and an empty list is returned instead. No changes are required to the API policies. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- The openstackclient will need to be extended to render this new field as part of the 'server show' command. The novaclient will need to be extended to render this new field as part of the 'hypervisor-show' and 'show' commands. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: sfinucan Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Expose per-host hugepage availability and usage via the API * Expose per-instance hugepage usage via the API Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= As we are merely exposing existing data, only API tests will be required. Documentation Impact ==================== The Operations Guide needs to be updated to reflect this new feature. References ========== * * `resource-classes` blueprint: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova-specs/tree/specs/mitaka/approved/resource-classes.rst History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Newton - Introduced

subject: Add helper scripts for generating policy info
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-25 21:20:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy/commit/2611ddb072288769086f25470ab2ba0c4c0ba77c', 'message': 'Add helper methods for generating policy info

This adds two helper methods that consuming projects can use to get
information that helps deployers.

The generate_policy method takes a configured policy.Enforcer and
outputs a yaml formatted policy file for that configuration. This can be
used for audit purposes or to use with a tool like oslopolicy-checker.

The generate_matches method takes a configured policy.Enforcer and
returns a list of policy.RuleDefault objects for policies defined in a
config file which match registered defaults. This helps deployers winnow
down their configured policies to just those that are actual overrides.

Change-Id: Ibe4e6c9288768bcc8f532e384524580c57e58275
Partially-Implements: bp policy-sample-generation
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-26 13:44:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy/commit/9fd6ddf10e9b512051dd0ecd411f8daec32af2ca', 'message': 'Add helper methods for generating policy info

This adds two helper methods that consuming projects can use to get
information that helps deployers.

The generate_policy method takes a configured policy.Enforcer and
outputs a yaml formatted policy file for that configuration. This can be
used for audit purposes or to use with a tool like oslopolicy-checker.

The generate_matches method takes a configured policy.Enforcer and
returns a list of policy.RuleDefault objects for policies defined in a
config file which match registered defaults. This helps deployers winnow
down their configured policies to just those that are actual overrides.

Change-Id: Ibe4e6c9288768bcc8f532e384524580c57e58275
Partially-Implements: bp policy-sample-generation
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-31 22:22:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy/commit/3822ee2a5d37421a188ad1ca7527c9fe5e9e1826', 'message': 'Add helper scripts for generating policy info

This adds two helper scripts that consuming projects can use to get
information that helps deployers.

The oslopolicy-policy-generator script looks at an entry_point for a
configured policy.Enforcer and outputs a yaml formatted policy file for
that configuration. This is a merge of registered rules and configured
rules.

The oslopolicy_matches_generator script looks at an entry_point for a
configured policy.Enforcer and outputs a yaml formatted policy file with
a list of policies where the registered default matches the project
configuration. These are policies that can be removed from the
configuration file(s) without affecting policy.

commit_message:
Add helper scripts for generating policy info

This adds two helper scripts that consuming projects can use to get
information that helps deployers.

The oslopolicy-policy-generator script looks at an entry_point for a
configured policy.Enforcer and outputs a yaml formatted policy file for
that configuration. This is a merge of registered rules and configured
rules.

The oslopolicy_list_redundant script looks at an entry_point for a
configured policy.Enforcer and outputs a yaml formatted policy file with
a list of policies where the registered default matches the project
configuration. These are policies that can be removed from the
configuration file(s) without affecting policy.

Change-Id: Ibe4e6c9288768bcc8f532e384524580c57e58275
Implements: bp policy-sample-generation
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy refs/changes/43/321243/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def generate_policy(enforcer, output_file=None): """Generate a policy file showing what will be used. This takes all registered policies and merges them with what's defined in a policy file and outputs the result. That result is the effective policy that will be honored by policy checks. :param enforcer: a policy.Enforcer object. This should match what is used for policy checks in the service. :param output_file: The path of a file to output to. stdout used if None. """ # Ensure that files have been parsed enforcer.load_rules() output_file = (open(output_file, 'w') if output_file else sys.stdout) file_rules = [policy.RuleDefault(name, default.check_str) for name, default in enforcer.file_rules.items()] registered_rules = [policy.RuleDefault(name, default.check_str) for name, default in enforcer.registered_rules.items() if name not in enforcer.file_rules] policies = {'rules': file_rules + registered_rules} for section in _sort_and_format_by_section(policies, include_help=False): output_file.write(section) def generate_matches(enforcer): """Generate a list of configured policies which match defaults. This checks all policies loaded from policy files and checks to see if they match registered policies. If so then it is redundant to have them defined in a policy file and operators should consider removing them. :param enforcer: a policy.Enforcer object. This should match what is used for policy checks in the service. :returns: A list of policy.RuleDefault objects """ # Ensure that files have been parsed enforcer.load_rules() matches = [] for name, file_rule in enforcer.file_rules.items(): reg_rule = enforcer.registered_rules.get(name, None) if reg_rule: if file_rule == reg_rule: matches.append(reg_rule) return matches

commit_message:
Evaluate base64-encoded commands in case of sudo

This fix makes it possible to call complex
commands that use variables with sudo by getting
rid of escaping special characters.

Change-Id: I973a6bbb244833dff84ead7e7900806031966514
Closes-Bug: #1583368

commit_message:
Support serializing ipaddress objs with jsonutils

Fixes jsonutils.to_primitive so that it can serialize ipaddress
objects, as used by Python 3 or through the backport in
global-requirements.txt. Current support for netaddr is maintained.

Change-Id: I6aa1ecd5be754f61cdda4e47bc0e0180e232b366
Closes-bug: 1590076

commit_message:
Merge StorletRequest classes

Previously, we have multiple StorletRequest classes, corrensponding
to the types of Storlet execution.
This patch merges these classes into one, to remove swift specific
idea from storlet_gateway.

Change-Id: I8b1037baee44392b4d37a43b37e01573c825e691
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/63/324663/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: (1) The class StorletRequest what goes in and comes out of the gateway. def __init__(self, request, params, stream): def gateway_proxy_put_copy_flow(self, req, sreq): # TODO(talashi): chunk size should be configurable stream = iter(lambda: request.environ['wsgi.input'].read, '') sreq = DockerStorletRequest(orig_req, orig_req.params, stream) return self.gateway_proxy_put_copy_flow(orig_req, sreq) sreq = DockerStorletRequest(orig_req, orig_req.params, src_response.app_iter) return self.gateway_proxy_put_copy_flow(orig_req, sreq) sreq = DockerStorletRequest(orig_resp, req.params, orig_resp.app_iter) sreq = DockerStorletRequest(orig_resp, req.params, orig_resp.app_iter)
deleted_lines: (1) The classes StorletGetRequest, StorletPutRequest. These encapsulate what goes in and comes out of the gateway. Both share a mutual parent: DockerStorletRequest augmentStorletRequest def _getInitialRequest(self): return self.request def __init__(self, account, request, params, stream): self.account = account self.request = requestclass StorletGetRequest(DockerStorletRequest): def __init__(self, account, orig_resp, params): super(StorletGetRequest, self).__init__( self, account, orig_resp, params, orig_resp.app_iter) class StorletPutRequest(DockerStorletRequest): def __init__(self, account, request): reader = request.environ['wsgi.input'].read # TODO(takashi): chunk size should be configurable stream = iter(lambda: reader(65536), '') super(StorletPutRequest, self).__init__( self, account, request, request.params, stream) class StorletSloRequest(DockerStorletRequest): def __init__(self, account, orig_resp, params): super(StorletSloRequest, self).__init__( self, account, orig_resp, params, orig_resp.app_iter) class StorletCopyRequest(DockerStorletRequest): def __init__(self, account, request, src_resp): super(StorletCopyRequest, self).__init__( self, account, request, request.params, src_resp.app_iter) def gateway_proxy_put_copy_flow(self, sreq): req = sreq._getInitialRequest() sreq = StorletPutRequest(self.account, orig_req) return self.gateway_proxy_put_copy_flow(sreq) sreq = StorletCopyRequest(self.account, orig_req, src_response) return self.gateway_proxy_put_copy_flow(sreq) sreq = StorletSloRequest(self.account, orig_resp, req.params) sreq = StorletGetRequest(self.account, orig_resp, req.params) orig_resp = sreq._getInitialRequest()

subject: Improve handling of fds in StorletInvocationProtocol
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-04 08:31:08.000000000', 'files': ['Engine/swift/storlet_gateway/storlet_runtime.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/storlets/commit/ed78436ae30a85ad96f2343045f4bd73645d6684', 'message': 'Improve handling of fds in StorletInvocationProtocol

This patch is a follow-up patch of If763da213e02829d492dc639037323f548224c68,
which introduces property functions to get a list of remote fds and their
metadata, into StorletInvocationProtocol class.

Change-Id: I6a287a64d5d164578ba210f39ab06eaac8142c8b
'}]
commit_message:
Improve handling of fds in StorletInvocationProtocol

This patch is a follow-up patch of If763da213e02829d492dc639037323f548224c68,
which introduces property functions to get a list of remote fds and their
metadata, into StorletInvocationProtocol class.

Change-Id: I6a287a64d5d164578ba210f39ab06eaac8142c8b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/storlets refs/changes/53/325553/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @property def remote_fds(self): return [self.input_data_read_fd, self.execution_str_write_fd, self.data_write_fd, self.metadata_write_fd, self.storlet_logger.getfd()] @property def remote_fds_metadata(self): input_fd_metadata = {'type': SBUS_FD_INPUT_OBJECT} if self.srequest.user_metadata: for key, val in self.srequest.user_metadata.iteritems(): input_fd_metadata[key] = val return [input_fd_metadata, {'type': SBUS_FD_OUTPUT_TASK_ID}, {'type': SBUS_FD_OUTPUT_OBJECT}, {'type': SBUS_FD_OUTPUT_OBJECT_METADATA}, {'type': SBUS_FD_LOGGER}] """ Create all pipse used for Storlet execution """ dtg.set_files(self.remote_fds) dtg.set_metadata(self.remote_fds_metadata)
deleted_lines: def _add_input_stream(self): self.fds.append(self.input_data_read_fd) # TODO(Break request metadata and systemmetadata) md = dict() md['type'] = SBUS_FD_INPUT_OBJECT if self.srequest.user_metadata is not None: for key, val in self.srequest.user_metadata.iteritems(): md[key] = val self.fdmd.append(md) def _add_output_stream(self): self.fds.append(self.execution_str_write_fd) md = dict() md['type'] = SBUS_FD_OUTPUT_TASK_ID self.fdmd.append(md) self.fds.append(self.data_write_fd) md = dict() md['type'] = SBUS_FD_OUTPUT_OBJECT self.fdmd.append(md) self.fds.append(self.metadata_write_fd) md = dict() md['type'] = SBUS_FD_OUTPUT_OBJECT_METADATA self.fdmd.append(md) def _add_logger_stream(self): self.fds.append(self.storlet_logger.getfd()) md = dict() md['type'] = SBUS_FD_LOGGER self.fdmd.append(md) # Add the input stream self._add_input_stream() # Add the output stream self._add_output_stream() # Add the logger self._add_logger_stream() dtg.set_files(self.fds) dtg.set_metadata(self.fdmd) # remote side file descriptors and their metadata lists # to be sent as part of invocation self.fds = list() self.fdmd = list()

commit_message:
Make the volume transfer name field required

In the 'Create Transfer Form', if the input name is blank, there will
cast error:"Error: Unable to create volume transfer", So the name field
should be required.

Change-Id: Ia749cfa5eb0bce4b778fa2099705fdba43dc0b0c
Closes-Bug: #1566113
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/32/301432/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name = forms.CharField(max_length=255, label=_("Transfer Name"))

commit_message:
Skip release notes jobs for pre-Mitaka os-brick and python-cinderclient

The os-brick and python-cinderclient projects did not have reno release
notes until the Mitaka release. This adds them to the list of projects
to skip the gate-*-releasenotes tests for Liberty and earlier.

Change-Id: I1b756a7e7eba6c92c5d4b68032273eb1cc7d7e99

subject: Ironic: fetch tempest plugin from git for non-master
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-06 20:58:42.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/7c452b28a2228568a5e3d24add0ba1d270fd355a', 'message': 'Ironic: fetch tempest plugin from git for non-master

The current setup will always use the tempest plugin from the version of
ironic under test. However, we want to always use the master version of
the plugin, so if the change is not proposed against master, fetch
master from git for the tempest plugin.

Change-Id: I9aeb1ac42a85c31115c25cb7fba883da24b45203
'}]
commit_message:
Ironic: fetch tempest plugin from git for non-master

The current setup will always use the tempest plugin from the version of
ironic under test. However, we want to always use the master version of
the plugin, so if the change is not proposed against master, fetch
master from git for the tempest plugin.

Change-Id: I9aeb1ac42a85c31115c25cb7fba883da24b45203
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/37/326137/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" != "master" ]] ; then # NOTE(jroll) if this isn't a patch against master, then # fetch master to install the plugin export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS=git+git://git.openstack.org/openstack/ironic" else # on master, use the local change, so we can pick up any changes to the plugin export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"TEMPEST_PLUGINS=/opt/stack/new/ironic" fi

commit_message:
Move puppet-tacker to Openstack

- openstack puppet community has approved via email
  to accept this puppet module to the puppet
  community

commit_message:
Fix building nodes panel for zuul launchers

We will never have manager nodes that are set to building, because
zuul-launcher does not work that way.  Switch back to target for
building.

Change-Id: I20f841473987b5099b7869ae69a4ce3cca696e71
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Changed namespace from kolla to kollaglue in oslo

The oslo configuration generates containers that default namespace
to kolla instead of kollaglue docker hub registry upstream.
The impact of this bug is that when using oslo config generator,
the default containers can't be launched.

Change-Id: I29a75874af0453df89eca6d6a9294441204d85f5
Closes-Bug: #1590619
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/33/327433/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: namespace = kollaglue

commit_message:
[contributor] Explain Project install guides

Add new section on project install guides.

Change-Id: Idb59c3a301b7b0993fd588865f7f241c00423030
Partially-Implements: blueprint projectspecificinstallguides
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/70/327470/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =============================== Project specific install guides =============================== Project specific installation guides can be set up as follows: * Use the ``installguide-cookiecutter <https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/installguide-cookiecutter>`` cookiecutter to create a skeleton for your project. This adds content to the ``install-guide`` directory in the top-level of the project repository. * Include a ``tox.ini`` environment for 'install-guide': .. code:: [testenv:install-guide] # NOTE(jaegerandi): this target does not use constraints because # upstream infra does not yet support it. Once that's fixed, we can # drop the install_command. install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages} commands = sphinx-build -a -E -W -d install-guide/build/doctrees -b html install-guide/source install-guide/build/html * Add the python package ``openstackdocs-theme`` to the ``test-requirements.txt`` file. * Once the changes above are merged, add jobs for it in the ``openstack-infra/project-config`` repository. Define the jobs using the JJB ``install-guide-jobs`` job-template in file ``jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml`` like: .. code-block:: yaml ... - install-guide-jobs: service: orchestration Here ``service`` is the service name of the project, like orchestration for heat. Add the ``install-guide-jobs`` template to ``zuul/layout.yaml`` to schedule the jobs. * TBD: How to create master index file for this.

commit_message:
Refactor Storlet protocol classes

Previously, we have multiple Storlet protocol classes, corresponding
to each execution place, each methods.
This patch refactors these classes, and introduces a common protocol
class, which is used for all storlet executuions.
This patch also makes sure that we use a iterator as stream in
Storlet Request classes, as which we previously use file descriptor
only for GET.

Change-Id: If763da213e02829d492dc639037323f548224c68

operator would consider errors.

commit_message:
Add install-guide for heat

This adds heat-specific contents of the OpenStack Installation Guide
in the heat repo per [1]. A separate change will remove the heat
contents from the OpenStack Installation Guide for Newton per [2].

The heat install-guide structure is based on Install Guide
Cookiecutter [3].

Also adds tox.ini environment for install-guide and adds
openstackdocs-theme to test-requirements.txt.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/docs-specs/specs/newton/project-specific-installguides.html
[2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/docs-specs/specs/newton/installguide.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/314229/

Change-Id: I153b27dd17e5a22224bda473b19dbd76ca0cdc98
Partially-Implements: blueprint projectspecificinstallguides

Source the ``admin`` tenant credentials: .. code-block:: console $ . admin-openrc #. commit_message:
Put an upper bound on eventlet

This avoids the 0.18.x release which has been rife with problems for
openstack. At least in the Kilo release, use of 0.18.2 will cause
continued tracebacks out of eventlet, which doesn't completely stop the
service, just makes it really hard to do anything.

Closes-Bug: #1544801

https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/290

Change-Id: I1755d9e808cb8f839961d5b96e0374ba623f127b

commit_message:
Don't record time when self.timing is False

The expected behavior is when timing is True, then we record each
request's time, then we should call reset_timings() to release memory.

However, the shell, client.{HTTPClient,SessionClient} will record each
request's time no matter what timing is set, then after long running
time in service like ceilometer-agent-compute, the memory keeps increasing.

We'd better not record request's time when timing is set to False.
Users are not responiable to call reset_timings() when they don't want
timing functionality.

Change-Id: I3e7d2fadf9a21be018781d528a1b6562228da6dd
Closes-Bug: #1433491
(cherry picked from commit 1c39f8fabf8ed44e0de563893d5813be1bf7b5e3)

commit_message:
Fix skipped image create attribute location attr

Image create action accepts attribute called location,
in method body is list of allowed attributes, which contain
localtion, what is typo and this attribute was not passed to
glance. Fixed.

Change-Id: I357b06b63b8aa97f7a5f587ef3fcee7a4b360ed1
Closes-Bug: #1445460
(cherry picked from commit d363068617ea37cf17583c390df69f3bbe7ff45c)

commit_message:
Revert "Do not print 'Created' message when using non-table formatter"

This patch broke DLRN (RDO trunk) CI jobs for stable/liberty. The same
issue affects Kilo branch of puppet-neutron module too.

Closes-Bug: #1589442
This reverts commit ce05ad751d5b5840515bb5a6d7837015978deaaf.

Change-Id: I7ec7e66e0d5f509c3738fab5690077f95a95d99f

subject: Revert "nova flavor-show command is inconsistent"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 20:04:05.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/unit/test_base.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/fakes.py', 'novaclient/v2/shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_flavors.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/7e955078b869fd822a1ec6db744474c9adf01ab2', 'message': 'Revert "nova flavor-show command is inconsistent"

This reverts commit 4e79285b45ec1490c8e923f724cbaf4d42fe81c4.

The aforementioned commit broke flavor-show for mixed case flavorids.
The reason is a bit complex. On the nova api side, there is caching of
db items for flavors, keyed off the flavorid retrieved from the db,
case sensitive, unlike the db query itself. Attempts to flavor-show
a flavor with flavorid composed of letters will fail with a 400 if
the capitalization doesn't match.

For the flavor names, they work in lowercase because the find_resource
function falls back on a search by "human_id" after failing every other
attempt to find the flavor, because "human_id" is a oslo-slugified
string (all lowercase, non-word characters removed, spaces converted
to hyphens).

Closes-Bug: #1446850

Change-Id: I73247b50f5a6918167c071ccc13cd676aa2c7fec
(cherry picked from commit 098116d6a574b8dede101b257db2ff22d269c6c7)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "nova flavor-show command is inconsistent"

This reverts commit 4e79285b45ec1490c8e923f724cbaf4d42fe81c4.

The aforementioned commit broke flavor-show for mixed case flavorids.
The reason is a bit complex. On the nova api side, there is caching of
db items for flavors, keyed off the flavorid retrieved from the db,
case sensitive, unlike the db query itself. Attempts to flavor-show
a flavor with flavorid composed of letters will fail with a 400 if
the capitalization doesn't match.

For the flavor names, they work in lowercase because the find_resource
function falls back on a search by "human_id" after failing every other
attempt to find the flavor, because "human_id" is a oslo-slugified
string (all lowercase, non-word characters removed, spaces converted
to hyphens).

Closes-Bug: #1446850

Change-Id: I73247b50f5a6918167c071ccc13cd676aa2c7fec
(cherry picked from commit 098116d6a574b8dede101b257db2ff22d269c6c7)

subject: Stale OF entries retained in br-int
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-04 14:15:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/1ef5a71cd0d5b2efa41602c6c5d8ca391b444b9d', 'message': 'Stale OF entries retained in br-int

The del-manager was triggered from the plugin.sh script
before deleting the neutron ports. This was the reason for
unicast mac flows not getting removed. Fixed it by first
delting the neutron port and then deleting the ovs contoller

commit_message:
Stale OF entries retained in br-int

The del-manager was triggered from the plugin.sh script
before deleting the neutron ports. This was the reason for
unicast mac flows not getting removed. Fixed it by first
delting the neutron port and then deleting the ovs contoller
configuration.
Change-Id: I2724089724460c7b6b48f5121ddea2058351da9b
Signed-off-by: mailravi02 <mailravi02@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Clarify our use of Text(length) and explicitly restrict it to mysql

Specify Text length only for mysql.  Add a comment to explain
why we specify this long length.

SQLAlchemy mysql dialect uses the length argument of Text() to
choose a backing type.  (TEXT, LONGTEXT, ...)
However Text() usually doesn't need the length argument and
some dialects (eg. postgresql) bail out with errors when it's given.

Also, remove the length argument from the model because it doesn't
serve any purposes.

Reference: http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_1_0/core/type_basics.html#sqlalchemy.types.Text

Backport note: This commit was edited to exclude test_migrations part.

Closes-Bug: #1556090
Change-Id: I78ae899df080a7aa1bb78ed75d8e43a9bf75103e
(cherry picked from commit 11e7099788233d7281cb4ec67ea4ea9b0dbc1de9)

commit_message:
Remove invalid parameter on Keystone client call

Keystone client versions below 1.4.0 don't accept the unscoped parameter.
DOA on the stable/kilo branch restricts the Keystone client version to be
below 1.4.0 but passes the unscoped parameter. We either need to fix DOA
to not pass the parameter or increase the Keystone client version.
Increasing the Keystone client version could break other things, so remove
usage of the parameter.

This fix only applies to stable/kilo, as Liberty and beyond use a high
enough Keystone client version. So this fix cannot be cherry picked from
a later branch.

Change-Id: Ib2237bf91c8d626b8f290b0ee7424a5397fdfb40
Closes-Bug: #1566455

commit_message:
Remove low-level PyKMIP test asserts

This change removes two low-level asserts that test the internals of
PyKMIP core. The referenced portions of PyKMIP have been modified in the
latest release. Once the latest release has been published, these asserts
will be added back in, modified to work properly with the new version of
PyKMIP.

Conflicts:
	barbican/tests/plugin/test_kmip.py

Depends-On: I2ba2b8ae8ba2324559a0c24aed06a3041929ac50

commit_message:
Making the generate labs script more nicer.

Adding a few comments and some echo commands to make the script output
more nicer.

Change-Id: Id3eb2847b42ecf5ad886b7ddb175717fddcd1067
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/64/327464/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash - # # DESCRIPTION # # User by tox.ini to create required scripts and tar balls for # hosting the contents of this project. # # Note: Execute this script from the root of the repository for expected # results. set -o nounset # Treat unset variables as an error # This variable is fed by openstack-ci post job as a trigger. # The value here will be stable/<release-name> if [ $# -eq 0 ]; then release="current" else release=$1 fi # Replace '/' with '-' for renaming stable/<release-name> to # stable-<release-name> release=${release////-} echo "Current OpenStack release: $release" # Create required folders mkdir -p ./build/dist/ # Create tarball of labs scripts for Linux/OS X users echo 'Creating the tar-balls.' tar --exclude=*.iso \ --exclude=*.vdi \ --exclude=*.log \ --exclude=*.auto \ -czf build/dist/labs-${release}.tgz labs/osbash # Generate Windows batch scripts labs/osbash/osbash.sh -w cluster #labs/osbash/osbash.sh -w cluster # Create zip file of labs scripts for Windows users echo 'Generating zip files.' zip -r build/dist/labs-${release}.zip labs/osbash \ -x \*.iso \*.vdi \*.log \*.auto

commit_message:
Serialize files when using SessionClient

SessionClient can not json serialize TemplateFiles object.
We should do them explictly.

Change-Id: Ia67562ae9a13c0975cb5c39532c0dc413d82c4c3
Closes-Bug: #1589519

commit_message:
Add validations for volume_size and destination_type

Add validations for volume_size and destination_type of
block device mapping when creating an instance
in order to avoid HTTP 500 errors.
Validations has been added in V2.1 API only.
Validations that has been added are as follows:

* volume_size: an empty string
* volume_size: zero
* volume_size: greater than DB column's limit
* destination_type: an empty string
* destination_type: invalid value

Change-Id: I2d3084cccd15f409616031f106c611ff07ac4abf
Closes-Bug: #1525806
(cherry picked from commit 9ad3dad0c6ab868566e74f0c35a5375d4eaad560)

commit_message:
Implement Guru meditation reports

Guru can log runtime configuration of a given process, along with
thread status and greenthread status. It greatly help check the
process runtime status.

The usage is simple:
kill -USR2 {process-id}

In dragonflow, you can show the reports of df-controller,
df-publisher, df-l3-agent, and the coming df-metadata-service.

The description is as follows:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GuruMeditationReport

Closes-Bug: #1568220
Change-Id: I24048e1018ba3710b7a7476ca1dd83a5ae38894a

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging as sys_logging from oslo_reports import guru_meditation_report as gmr from dragonflow import version # During the call to gmr.TextGuruMeditation.setup_autorun(), Guru Meditation # Report tries to start logging. Set a handler here to accommodate this. logger = sys_logging.getLogger(None) if not logger.handlers: logger.addHandler(sys_logging.StreamHandler()) _version_string = version.version_info.release_string() gmr.TextGuruMeditation.setup_autorun(version=_version_string)

commit_message:
Don't clear-out all repos in puppet cleanup

dib 1.17.0 includes fixes for debian-minimal to work with the
apt-sources element in I69dbaa34be3db3d667e6bd8450ef4ce04a751c70

This moved to having the base repos split out from the usual
/etc/apt/sources.list into separate files in /etc/apt/sources.list.d

Unfortunately, this puppet module does the cleanup by glob removal of
everything in that directory, which is a bit unsafe.

I've refactored this slightly so that, like the RedHat path, we only
remove the puppetlabs repos files.

Change-Id: I5bcd8880a90d238b77aaacfd1eaf0a720552c7ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/34/327434/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: case $OS_FAMILY in "Debian") repo=/etc/apt/sources.list.d/puppetlabs.list update="apt-get update" ;; "RedHat") repo=/etc/yum.repos.d/puppetlabs.repo # yum/dnf will notice this is gone, so don't need to spend # time updating. update="" ;; *) die "Don't know how to cleanup!" esac rm -f $repo $update
deleted_lines: if [ "$OS_FAMILY" == "Debian" ] ; then rm -f /etc/apt/sources.list.d/* apt-get update elif [ "$OS_FAMILY" == "RedHat" ] ; then # Can't delete * in yum.repos.d since all of the repos are listed there. # Be specific instead. if [ -f /etc/yum.repos.d/puppetlabs.repo ] ; then sudo rm -f /etc/yum.repos.d/puppetlabs.repo fi fi

commit_message:
Enable functional test job in openstack ci for networking-ovn

There are no functionak tests for networking-ovn and it would
be good to have. This patch enables functional testing as a non
voting job to start with.

Change-Id: I05aca798e8b28101665d980cc0924e254b063a5e

commit_message:
Remove Ironic container creation from AIO preparation

Currently the Ironic containers are created as part of the AIO
preparation, but Ironic is not deployed due to run-playbooks.sh
excluding it by the default of 'DEPLOY_IRONIC=no'.

In order to prepare for the change of run-playbooks from a bash
script to instead using the standard deployment playbooks which
are used in the install guide, this patch removes the AIO conf.d
entry implementation for Ironic.

The example file remains in place for any deployers wishing to
test Ironic.

Change-Id: Idec60e8b85070aaa122a361141aa25b4acc152c2

commit_message:
Only reset dns_name when unbinding port if DNS is integrated

We only set the dns_name on the port if the "DNS Integration"
extension is enabled, so we should only reset it on the port
when unbinding if the extension is enabled, otherwise some
Neutron stadium plugins will fail since they don't expect
the 'dns_name' attribute to be on the port.

NOTE(mriedem): This backport adds an import that wasn't in
stable/mitaka but is used in the unit test from the original
patch.

Change-Id: I7451fbfad53236e9e147a0387dac45ae97f3e75b
Closes-Bug: #1574565
(cherry picked from commit b256cae8e204fbbf6f3d40f5f4d47013be018a6d)

commit_message:
Fix nova_system_group_uid variable name

The documented variable to use to set the nova group uid is:
nova_system_group_gid. Correct the variable name in the
nova_pre_install.yml task.

Change-Id: Ia4316c00c7dacae730c0802a9119141757e1eab6
Closes-Bug: 1589663
(cherry picked from commit 3ad285539356ab649757d16cb8b1fc3cc8c613cc)

commit_message:
Set check_mode variable every time

In check mode, the security role will fail when tags are used. This
is because the check_mode variable wasn't being set when tags were
provided. This patch ensures that the tasks that check for check mode
and set the subsequent check_mode variable will run every time.

Closes-bug: 1590086

Change-Id: Ib6a29ee4c36632cd6d982ce87105f0ddec4a891d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/64/326664/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | When the security role was run in Ansible's check mode and a tag was provided, the ``check_mode`` variable was not being set. Any tasks which depend on that variable would fail. This `bug is fixed <https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1590086>`_ and the ``check_mode`` variable is now set properly on every playbook run.

commit_message:
deps: add missing Oslo resources

It seems that Nova_config resources encapsulated in puppet-oslo modules
are not used by deps.pp orchestration. It might be a bug in Puppet but
as a result, some resources are not created at the right time.
This patch adds correct orchestration for Oslo resources.

Change-Id: Ia43983105d63265eda0ebefd5e3ccba47d64508e

commit_message:
Replace the tox macro by shell to pre-export env variable

The tox macro is really just run-tox.sh. It works well for us but
we need to export an environment variable to toggle tests that
would be invasive and destructive on a non-ephemeral environment.

Change-Id: I03023f4c14d91a3a74d8ffb8333bd1a621fbdfd9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/39/327439/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - shell: | export DESTRUCTIVE_TESTS="true" /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/run-tox.sh integration-{scenario}

Add period field to notification methods

This will allow periodic notifications

Change-Id: Ifa7c1e499d4ac45d543285463036b8a058f70c26

commit_message:
reference osc-lib in openstackclient utils

as part of the migration to osc-lib, we must continue to support
our existing public functions, however we can simply reference
osc-lib's equivalent and issue deprecation messages.

Change-Id: I28c278143104ab232097481c6707369defc78804
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/94/316594/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: import getpass import logging import os import six import time from oslo_utils import importutils from openstackclient.common import exceptions # Try to get entity as integer id try: if isinstance(name_or_id, int) or name_or_id.isdigit(): return manager.get(int(name_or_id), **kwargs) # FIXME(dtroyer): The exception to catch here is dependent on which # client library the manager passed in belongs to. # Eventually this should be pulled from a common set # of client exceptions. except Exception as ex: if type(ex).__name__ == 'NotFound': pass else: raise # Try directly using the passed value try: return manager.get(name_or_id, **kwargs) except Exception: pass if len(kwargs) == 0: kwargs = {} try: # Prepare the kwargs for calling find if 'NAME_ATTR' in manager.resource_class.__dict__: # novaclient does this for oddball resources kwargs[manager.resource_class.NAME_ATTR] = name_or_id else: kwargs['name'] = name_or_id except Exception: pass # finally try to find entity by name try: return manager.find(**kwargs) # FIXME(dtroyer): The exception to catch here is dependent on which # client library the manager passed in belongs to. # Eventually this should be pulled from a common set # of client exceptions. except Exception as ex: if type(ex).__name__ == 'NotFound': msg = "No %s with a name or ID of '%s' exists." % \ (manager.resource_class.__name__.lower(), name_or_id) raise exceptions.CommandError(msg) if type(ex).__name__ == 'NoUniqueMatch': msg = "More than one %s exists with the name '%s'." % \ (manager.resource_class.__name__.lower(), name_or_id) raise exceptions.CommandError(msg) else: pass for resource in manager.list(): # short circuit and return the first match if (resource.get('id') == name_or_id or resource.get('name') == name_or_id): return resource else: # we found no match, report back this error: msg = "Could not find resource %s" % name_or_id raise exceptions.CommandError(msg) output = "" for s in sorted(data): output = output + s + "='" + six.text_type(data[s]) + "', " return output[:-2] return separator.join(sorted(data)) return '\n'.join(format_dict(i) for i in data) try: if isinstance(item, dict): return item[field] else: return getattr(item, field) except Exception: msg = "Resource doesn't have field %s" % field raise exceptions.CommandError(msg) if mixed_case_fields is None: mixed_case_fields = [] if formatters is None: formatters = {} row = [] for field in fields: if field in mixed_case_fields: field_name = field.replace(' ', '_') else: field_name = field.lower().replace(' ', '_') data = getattr(item, field_name, '') if field in formatters: row.append(formatters[field](data)) else: row.append(data) return tuple(row) if mixed_case_fields is None: mixed_case_fields = [] if formatters is None: formatters = {} row = [] for field in fields: if field in mixed_case_fields: field_name = field.replace(' ', '_') else: field_name = field.lower().replace(' ', '_') data = item[field_name] if field_name in item else '' if field in formatters: row.append(formatters[field](data)) else: row.append(data) return tuple(row) if not sort_str: return items # items may be a generator object, transform it to a list items = list(items) sort_keys = sort_str.strip().split(',') for sort_key in reversed(sort_keys): reverse = False if ':' in sort_key: sort_key, direction = sort_key.split(':', 1) if not sort_key: msg = "empty string is not a valid sort key" raise exceptions.CommandError(msg) if direction not in ['asc', 'desc']: if not direction: direction = "empty string" msg = ("%s is not a valid sort direction for sort key %s, " "use asc or desc instead" % (direction, sort_key)) raise exceptions.CommandError(msg) if direction == 'desc': reverse = True items.sort(key=lambda item: get_field(item, sort_key), reverse=reverse) return items for v in vars: value = os.environ.get(v, None) if value: return value return kwargs.get('default', '') try: client_path = version_map[str(version)] except (KeyError, ValueError): msg = "Invalid %s client version '%s'. must be one of: %s" % ( (api_name, version, ', '.join(list(version_map.keys())))) raise exceptions.UnsupportedVersion(msg) return importutils.import_class(client_path) while True: res = status_f(res_id) status = getattr(res, status_field, '').lower() if status in success_status: retval = True break elif status in error_status: retval = False break if callback: progress = getattr(res, 'progress', None) or 0 callback(progress) time.sleep(sleep_time) return retval total_time = 0 while total_time < timeout: try: # might not be a bad idea to re-use find_resource here if it was # a bit more friendly in the exceptions it raised so we could just # handle a NotFound exception here without parsing the message res = manager.get(res_id) except Exception as ex: if type(ex).__name__ in exception_name: return True raise status = getattr(res, status_field, '').lower() if status in error_status: return False if callback: progress = getattr(res, 'progress', None) or 0 callback(progress) time.sleep(sleep_time) total_time += sleep_time # if we got this far we've timed out return False root_log = logging.getLogger() min_log_lvl = logging.CRITICAL for handler in root_log.handlers: min_log_lvl = min(min_log_lvl, handler.level) return min_log_lvl message = prompt or "User Password:" if hasattr(stdin, 'isatty') and stdin.isatty(): try: while True: first_pass = getpass.getpass(message) if not confirm: return first_pass second_pass = getpass.getpass("Repeat " + message) if first_pass == second_pass: return first_pass print("The passwords entered were not the same") except EOFError: # Ctl-D raise exceptions.CommandError("Error reading password.") raise exceptions.CommandError("There was a request to be prompted for a" " password and a terminal was not detected.") try: with open(blob_file) as file: blob = file.read().strip() return blob except IOError: msg = "Error occurred trying to read from file %s" raise exceptions.CommandError(msg % blob_file) kwargs = {} if value: kwargs[arg_name] = value return kwargs try: string.decode('ascii') return True except UnicodeDecodeError: return False

added_lines: # Lenka Huskov , 2016. #zanata msgid "" msgstr "" "Project-Id-Version: trove-dashboard 6.0.0.0rc2.dev36 " "Report-Msgid-Bugs-To: https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-i18n/ " "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-05-23 20:31+0000 " "MIME-Version: 1.0 " "Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8 " "Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit " "PO-Revision-Date: 2016-06-07 08:15+0000 " "Last-Translator: Lenka Huskov " "Language-Team: Czech " "Language: cs " "X-Generator: Zanata 3.7.3 " "Plural-Forms: nplurals=3; plural=(n==1) ? 0 : (n>=2 && n<=4) ? 1 : 2 " msgid "" " " " Move networks from 'Available Networks' to 'Selected Networks' by " " clicking the button, or dragging and dropping. commit_message:
Translation: create the locale directory

The commit cc6bd514890265daf54618eb9193e70d15c310d3 did not create
the locale directory. This prevents the translation jobs from running.

Change-Id: I007d2db26587858733c633bd8362762eef2292ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/03/292103/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Adding support for periodic notifications

New periodic notification engine that will take a notification send it, and then
place it back onto the periodic notification topic. Once the alarm associated
with the notification has transitioned to a state that is different from the
original state the notification is removed from the queue.

Change-Id: Ie3103a0ec30abcd8dfc53869b1c3135953aabf3a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-notification refs/changes/13/296813/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'raw_alarm', 'periodic_interval' self.periodic_interval = alarm['periodic_interval'] 'tenant_id', 'periodic_interval'

commit_message:
Dell SC: Allow NAT/PAT when getting async results

There is an issue with the Dell SC API where it returns a full URL
for getting the results of an async action. This does not allow
for users that have different IP address, host names, and/or ports
for accessing the system between the client and the host.

As a workaround, adding parsing of the returned URL to be able to
reformat as we need it for calling from Cinder.

Also modified GET calls to never allow async handling and cleaned
up async processing to retry if a valid result is not received.

Change-Id: Ibec13c124a6b6bb6214920fecf3ca2d9ef2283a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/54/325954/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_async_url(self, url): """Handle a bug in SC API that gives a full url.""" if 'http' in url: # Strip off the host/port part proto_mark = url.find(':') return url[url.find('/', proto_mark + 3) + 1:] return url def _wait_for_async_complete(self, asyncTask): url = self._get_async_url(asyncTask.get('returnValue')) r = self.get(url) url = self._get_async_url(content.get('returnValue')) return r def get(self, url): return self.session.get(self.__formatUrl(url), headers=self._get_header(False), verify=self.verify)
deleted_lines: def _wait_for_async_complete(self, asyncTask): url = asyncTask.get('returnValue') r = self.session.get(url, headers=self.header, verify=self.verify) url = content.get('returnValue') return r def get(self, url, async=False): return self._rest_ret(self.session.get(self.__formatUrl(url), headers=self._get_header(async), verify=self.verify), async)

commit_message:
horizon job to use tempest plugin in gate

The horizon tempest plugin is working and horizon integration
has been removed from tempest. It's time to change horizon to use
the horizon tempest plugin in the gate and make the job voting.

This change also removes horizon's use of the
gate-tempest-dsvm-full job as this no longer tests horizon.

Change-Id: I3f2a996f26c462edd968fb961c05cebc83b175a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/26/327226/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Ironic nodes with instance_uuid are not available

Currently, if a node is in AVAILABLE or NOSTATE (legacy), regardless of
if it has an instance_uuid it is considered able to be scheduled to.
However, it's impossible for a deployment to succeed to an ironic node
with instance_uuid populated. We should not schedule to nodes in this
state.

Change-Id: I41e0c8f1f8a91e11180a6edd72907cf76fe4b235
Closes-bug: 1503453
(cherry picked from commit ffe3093786b137f46646c4cf5fb3ba6b597418a9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/96/323196/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'provision_state': ironic_states.DELETED}, # a node in AVAILABLE with an instance uuid {'uuid': uuidutils.generate_uuid(), 'instance_uuid': uuidutils.generate_uuid(), 'power_state': ironic_states.POWER_OFF, 'provision_state': ironic_states.AVAILABLE} # these are both ok and should present as available as they # have no instance_uuid
deleted_lines: 'provision_state': ironic_states.DELETED} # these are both ok and should present as available

commit_message:
Unavailable hosts have no resources for use

If a host's:

  * resources are unavailable
  * in a unusable state

the system should:

  * report 0 resources
  * show 0 resources
  * not be scheduled to

Change-Id: Ia1c2f6f161dde1e23acce85a54566d07805d13df
Closes-Bug: 1503453
(cherry picked from commit 016b810f675b20e8ce78f4c82dc9c679c0162b7a)

commit_message:
Delay opening a log file until first use

Instead of creating a large amount of empty log files
immediately delay there creation until they are actually
used.

TrivalFix

Change-Id: Ib179cbbd86a60b0258882edd4078dbf435c30b26
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/42/322342/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: handler = logging.FileHandler(filename, delay=True)
