commit_message:
Switch to keystoneauth

keytoneclient.auth is deprecated in favour of keystoneauth.
This patch switches keystoneclient.auth to keystoneauth and removes the
keystoneclient requirement as we no longer use it anywhere else.

Change-Id: I96cd9b86cb6d66886df7be483514ed3698602217

commit_message:
Create common under storlet_gateway

This introduces storlet_gaeway.common module, which includes some
common functions/classes about storlets, like StorletException.

Change-Id: Ibb916e31279ccf3a10863ca06e7eead261edbed0

commit_message:
Use dib-python in pkg-map/bin/pkg-map

Because not all systems have a "python" binary, we need to rely on the
dib-python wrapper, which finds both python3 and python(2).  This should
fix the image build for Ubuntu 16.04 LTS "Xenial Xerus" in particular.

Signed-off-by: Simon Leinen <simon.leinen@gmail.com>
Closes-bug: 1577105
Change-Id: I3d31147229f53581f3201c7f053157c3024caa36
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/34/311634/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ "${DIB_RELEASE}" = "xenial" ]; then # # Ubuntu 16.04 (Xenial) only has Python 3 installed by default. # But diskimage-builder currently relies on Python 2 being present, # so we need to install that. # install-packages python fi

commit_message:
beaker: export PUPPET_MAJ_VERSION

When running Beaker in OpenStack Infra, export PUPPET_MAJ_VERSION so
install_modules.sh script in our CI will set the right path when using
Puppet4.

Change-Id: I710abb4bdea4efb02ffa1e38691c36bcfb699c53

commit_message:
Fix for the case with ceph and cinder-vmware

- For base configuration we use cinder.pp,
  but ceph for volume uses
  "::openstack_tasks::openstack_cinder::openstack_cinder" and
  configure volume only on controllers node. This patch fixes
  error in case with ceph with volume and assign cinder-vmware
  on controllers node.
- Describe parameters
- Fix typos
- Update noop tests
- Update spec

Change-Id: I1746dcd93f86ff4e1308d917d4a07dab7a5f1075
Closes-Bug: #1582113

commit_message:
Introduce amqp_durable_queues option

amqp_durable_queues option is already defined in trove class,
but is not be used in other trove class.

Close-Bug: #1486319
Change-Id: Ifd4411ce90db26d6f12e714fdc5c54ea507975fd
(cherry picked from commit d91b9599b41e7951a30385054a23721d0ed2ebc1)

commit_message:
Provide default service_name for keystone endpoint

This change updates the sahara::keystone::auth class to include a default
service_name of 'sahara' so that if a user changes the auth_name, the
service is still created as being related to 'sahara'.  This improves the
user experiance when they want to customize the usernames for services.

Change-Id: I8c6240473213b107de862edf359834b5494e9f74
Closes-Bug: #1590040
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-sahara refs/changes/40/326840/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

When attempting to allow_access on a managed share, it fails
because the proper share ID is not retrieved from private storage
prior to attempting to validate that the share exists in the
backend. The same happens when trying to create a share from a
snapshot created from a managed share, the proper share ID is
not retrieved from private storage. While we are dealing with
two possible different IDs it is important to properly display
the API share ID in log messages so it can be matched to the

commit_message:
Fix HDS HNAS errors caused by incorrect IDs

When attempting to allow_access on a managed share, it fails
because the proper share ID is not retrieved from private storage
prior to attempting to validate that the share exists in the
backend. The same happens when trying to create a share from a
snapshot created from a managed share, the proper share ID is
not retrieved from private storage. While we are dealing with
two possible different IDs it is important to properly display
the API share ID in log messages so it can be matched to the
share instances ID, and not all log messages are accurately doing
so.

This change addresses this by retrieving the ID from
private storage first for update_access and
create_share_from_snapshot operations. The proper unit test changes
included in this patch required a refactor of several IDs to ensure
this problem is addressed in unit tests, thus it made sense to
address several bugs caused by the same problem, having the same fix
and requiring modifications to the same lines of code.

(cherry-picked from commit 081fc4860b7ba3a87020d2ddae006f667616fed0)
Closes-bug: #1581541
Closes-bug: #1584179
Closes-bug: #1583785
Change-Id: I8cdb1a8a72a4ac7e710f57e3c288d48cd2adf0dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/74/325874/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
HDS_HNAS: Fix improper error message

When attempting to delete a snapshot, if the filesystem is
unmounted, the error message is the output of the delete command.
The delete command should not be invoked in such scenario, and
a proper message should be included in the exception.

(cherry-picked from commit 8b1de88df1d6a84f8f674f3565a1636ffe0a3df3)
Change-Id: If60f8644d4aebf5f364de44c6bef8085d2e539f7
Closes-bug: #1582747

commit_message:
NetApp: DR look up config via host name

In multibackend config, the cDOT driver looks for stanzas with the
share_backend_name as the stanza name (assuming that that's the
hostname, which it isn't).

There needs to be a separation between these since
share_backend_name and stanza names can be different.

Change-Id: Id1c4380c5ac01a0b64645d249a7b61b4c2a62226
Closes-Bug: 1568997
(cherry picked from commit acf85cad20aa0bf76f524f3ad3eb4719a8b2b367)

commit_message:
Amend generic-resource-pools

Amends the generic-resource-pools spec with the following changes:

* Change terminology from "resource pool" to "resource provider"
* Change the REST API proposal to have /resource_providers endpoints
instead of /resource_pools endpoints
* Change the `openstack resource-pool` CLI commands to `openstack
resource-provider` CLI commands
* Adds a generation field to the output of the resource provider dicts
and update operations along with a note as to how the generation field
shall be used

Change-Id: Iefe28041fa9e81558ebac9f47016c4db43a92723

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on
py34 we have to run py34 env before py27.
This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini's list of envs
to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: Ife0c57c0d92d41018862aad744ef9af65ef87b21
Closes-bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Resolving minor issues with Magnum role that prevented installation from
succeeding.

Adding missing 'MySQL-python' dependency to
magnum_pip_packages
Adding path to 'magnum-db-manage' call to resolve pathing
issue with virtual environment
Adding missing 'Restart magnum services' handler
Removing libmysqlclient-dev from magnum_apt_packages due to conflict
with Galera packages
Correcting '*_proto' to '*_protocol'

Change-Id: I746ecb21ebfda70e207f239306e1ec38785917cb

commit_message:
Don't run puppet tests on rst/unit test changes

If the change is only for rst file or unit test on tempest,
don't run the puppet changes for avoiding much test operation time.

Change-Id: I0315210bf6fc7e18a5ef4291856921269da015db

commit_message:
xen: skip two more racey mox py34 test classes

These failed in an unrelated patch in the py34 job
due to using mox, so blacklist them until they
can be re-written away from using mox.

Change-Id: Iefa2a56e3c24d9c38ef20c15d2374220586260c3

commit_message:
Release Puppet OpenStack 9.0.0 (newton)

Release the first version of Puppet OpenStack 9.0.0 (Newton).
This version is our beta release of newton cycle.
Note: puppet-vswitch will follow its tag logic, so this one will be
5.0.0.

Change-Id: I07cceb85d3ae8d5e8e99adf8e667cc3ef3cb32ea

commit_message:
add distro check for support of quickstart

* check for rhel/centos
* note fedora is wip
* other distros are not supported

Change-Id: I87782d1b602c9e629bdc7f8191b7c5c3253b63e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/12/327212/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ -f /etc/redhat-release ]; then if grep -q -i "Red Hat\|Centos" /etc/redhat-release; then true; else echo "Red Hat Enterprise Linux and CentOS are currently supported" echo "We are working to add support for Fedora." exit 1 fi else echo "Sorry your linux distribution is not supported at this time" fi

added_lines: msg = _("Expected 'key=value' type, but got: %s") raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError(msg % str(values)) msg = _("Parameter 'nargs' is not allowed, but got %s") raise ValueError(msg % nargs) msg = _("'required_keys' must be a list") raise TypeError(msg) msg = _("'optional_keys' must be a list") raise TypeError(msg) msg = _( "Expected comma separated 'key=value' pairs, but got: %s" ) raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError(msg % str(kv)) msg = _( "Invalid keys %(invalid_keys)s specified.\n" "Valid keys are: %(valid_keys)s" raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError(msg % { 'invalid_keys': ', '.join(invalid_keys), 'valid_keys': ', '.join(valid_keys), }) msg = _( "Missing required keys %(missing_keys)s.\n" "Required keys are: %(required_keys)s" raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError(msg % { 'missing_keys': ', '.join(missing_keys), 'required_keys': ', '.join(self.required_keys), }) msg = _("Invalid range, %(min)s is not less than %(max)s") raise argparse.ArgumentError(self, msg % { 'min': range[0], 'max': range[1], }) msg = _("Invalid range, too many values") msg = _("%s expected a non-negative integer") raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError(msg % str(option_string))
deleted_lines: msg = _("Expected 'key=value' type, " "but got: %s") % (str(values)) raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError(msg) raise ValueError("Parameter 'nargs' is not allowed, but got %s" % nargs) raise TypeError("'required_keys' must be a list") raise TypeError("'optional_keys' must be a list") msg = ("Expected key=value pairs separated by comma, " "but got: %s" % (str(kv))) raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError(msg) msg = _("Invalid keys %(invalid_keys)s specified.\n" "Valid keys are: %(valid_keys)s.") raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError( msg % {'invalid_keys': ', '.join(invalid_keys), 'valid_keys': ', '.join(valid_keys)} msg = _("Missing required keys %(missing_keys)s.\n" "Required keys are: %(required_keys)s.") raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError( msg % {'missing_keys': ', '.join(missing_keys), 'required_keys': ', '.join(self.required_keys)} msg = "Invalid range, %s is not less than %s" % \ (range[0], range[1]) raise argparse.ArgumentError(self, msg) msg = "Invalid range, too many values" msg = "%s expected a non-negative integer" % (str(option_string)) raise argparse.ArgumentTypeError(msg)

commit_message:
Refactor of base Dockerfile to allow custom repo

This breaks up base dockerfile into OS family dockerfile. Also allows to
add add custom-dockerfile.yml which will be used instead of
debian-dockerfile. Alternatively we can break up any part of this code
to block-based and custom-dockerfile will only override blocks it needs
to.

To enable cutomized override file call build.py
--template-override=path-to-file

Only caveat is that header {% extends .. %} has to stay

Change-Id: I9bb35ce6a10e17cc47bbdd622b18c8ee69036efe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/89/323589/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_dockerfile_name(self, base_distro_family, path): # TODO(inc0): allow this file to be in /etc custom_dockerfile = os.path.join( path, "custom-dockerfile.j2") if os.path.isfile(custom_dockerfile): return "custom-dockerfile.j2" distro_dockerfile = os.path.join( path, base_distro_family + "-dockerfile.j2") if os.path.isfile(distro_dockerfile): return base_distro_family + "-dockerfile.j2" else: return "Dockerfile.j2" if self.base in ['fedora', 'centos', 'oraclelinux', 'rhel']: base_distro_family = "redhat" elif self.base in ['ubuntu', 'debian']: base_distro_family = "debian" for path in self.docker_build_paths: template_name = self._get_dockerfile_name(base_distro_family, path) 'base_distro_family': base_distro_family,

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: demo of how drivers could work

This is an idea how to deal with drivers in our code. It'll all boil
down to create mydriver-dockerfile.j2 and this will provide ultimate
freedom to any deployer.

Change-Id: Ic45c2f8ff6bb909fb186cf8f1ce6d24f2517bb57

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-15 08:10:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-thresh/commit/11a480d6eae0a601f39373738f8079fb29be58d3', 'message': "Perodic metric processing

With new field 'period' for
each metric, thresh component should
be able to properly recognize it and
act according to its value. Sparse metrics will
cause associated alarms to never enter
'UNDETERMINED' state, those with period will evaluate
according to it and those with period not set
will fallback to default behaviour.

Change-Id: Ibe0839123a15494ad45b809e68600c0acef3d330

'sporadic' being part of alarm expressions
allows monasca-thresh to determine if
given alarms can go back to UNDETERMINED
state in case of missing measurements.

Having 'sporadic=true' means that alarm
won't ever go back to UNDETERMINED. In case
of missing data it will be set to OK state.

Implements: blueprint alarmonlogs
Depends-On: Ia42f9a1be37c31416bdac341b092fe527f860c16
Change-Id: Ibe0839123a15494ad45b809e68600c0acef3d330

commit_message:
(Non)deterministic alarm processing

'deterministic' being part of alarm expressions
allows monasca-thresh to determine if
given alarms can go back to UNDETERMINED
state or not.

'deterministic' means that alarm
won't ever transititon to UNDETERMINED state,
even if there are no measurements received for
long enough. By default, all alarms
are assumed to be 'non-deterministic' which means
that they can transition to 'UNDETERMINED' state

Implements: blueprint alarmonlogs
Depends-On: Ia42f9a1be37c31416bdac341b092fe527f860c16
Change-Id: Ibe0839123a15494ad45b809e68600c0acef3d330

commit_message:
Change default service_name to 'designate'

While we were already able to pick an independent auth_name and
service_name; the service_name was defaulting to auth_name. Now it
has a value of its own to be consistent with other modules.

Change-Id: Ib73d8a5d48bdf053517b2f39c3d4640b3c36f455
Related-Bug: #1590040
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-designate refs/changes/90/327190/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Defaults to designate. $service_name = 'designate', service_name => $service_name,
deleted_lines: # Defaults to the value of auth_name. $service_name = undef, $real_service_name = pick($service_name, $auth_name) service_name => $real_service_name,

commit_message:
Reduce the default date range on Overview panel to 1 day

First, the default default date range used on Overview panel is made
configurable (setting OVERVIEW_DAYS_RANGE). Second, its default value
is set to 1 day. Changing the default behavior is aimed to improve
load time of the default page in the presence of large amounts of
data. If OVERVIEW_DAYS_RANGE setting is explicitly set to None, the
behavior remains the same - the default date range is from the
beginning of the current month until today.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Sutyagin <dsutyagin@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I55a0397f69e33ba9c8fb1f27d57838efcd8648af
Closes-Bug: #1508571

added_lines: yesterday = today - datetime.timedelta(days=1) self.start = yesterday

commit_message:
Fix incompatible code with python3 for tox pep8 test

"tox -e pep8" fails when python3 is used.
This patch fixes it.

Closes-Bug: #1583984

Change-Id: Idff17f64d2d4789acee08bd98902ae50312ddc92

commit_message:
log: don't create foo.log

test_tempest_set_log_file was calling tempest_set_log_file and never
resetting this value. That caused some other test to create foo.log
and not clean it up.

Change-Id: I23efe8fb89531752b01bdf9c0fbdc39c77058a51
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log refs/changes/87/321587/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: log.set_defaults() self.conf([]) self.assertEqual(log_file, self.conf.log_file) finally: log.tempest_set_log_file(None)

subject: Create the ARA project
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-25 20:37:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/d84321e316eb339cdf68401df71a3c06276b1c49', 'message': 'Create the ARA project

ARA: Ansible Run Analysis makes Ansible Playbook runs easier
to visualize, understand and troubleshoot.

ARA is three things:
- An Ansible callback plugin to record playbook runs into a local or
  remote database
- A CLI client to query the database
- A web interface to visualize the database

The project is an initiative of the RDO community to help parse
the results of CI jobs that are driven by Ansible.

More details are available on the opentack-infra mailing list [1]

Please note that there is no launchpad created for this project.
We would prefer skip an eventual migration and integrate with
StoryBoard directly.

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-infra/2016-May/004257.html

Change-Id: I39bfae2c4d83c250cb3c8dae1b2c68597f523f45
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-26 00:09:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/95a6b53b3964875f71577be79dd93cef8ccbd75e', 'message': 'Create the ARA project

ARA: Ansible Run Analysis makes Ansible Playbook runs easier
to visualize, understand and troubleshoot.

ARA is three things:
- An Ansible callback plugin to record playbook runs into a local or
  remote database
- A CLI client to query the database
- A web interface to visualize the database

The project is an initiative of the RDO community to help parse
the results of CI jobs that are driven by Ansible.

More details are available on the openstack-infra mailing list [1]

Please note that there is no launchpad created for this project.
We would prefer skip an eventual migration and integrate with
StoryBoard directly.

commit_message:
Create the ARA project

ARA: Ansible Run Analysis makes Ansible Playbook runs easier
to visualize, understand and troubleshoot.

ARA is three things:
- An Ansible callback plugin to record playbook runs into a local or
  remote database
- A CLI client to query the database
- A web interface to visualize the database

The project is an initiative of the RDO community to help parse
the results of CI jobs that are driven by Ansible.

More details are available on the openstack-infra mailing list [1]

Please note that there is no launchpad created for this project.
We would prefer skip an eventual migration and integrate with
StoryBoard directly.

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-infra/2016-May/004257.html

Change-Id: I39bfae2c4d83c250cb3c8dae1b2c68597f523f45

subject: Enable pre-selecting IPv6 IPs on Management network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-08 17:53:45.000000000', 'files': ['network/ports/management_from_pool_v6.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/f4b0962e6268f604b39f5c37c1a69108464d200a', 'message': "Enable pre-selecting IPv6 IPs on Management network

This change adds a management_from_pool_v6.yaml that operates like
the IPv6 equivalents for the other networks. Originally the
management network wasn't merged yet when the IPv6 templates were
developed, so this is technical debt that needs to be cleaned up.

Note that while there is not a dependency, this change is related
to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/322817/ which adds an IPv6

Change-Id: I3d97a92439022fc8a55f3a53bb20779ca7cfdee4
"}]
commit_message:
Enable pre-selecting IPv6 IPs on Management network

This change adds a management_from_pool_v6.yaml that operates like
the IPv6 equivalents for the other networks. Originally the
management network wasn't merged yet when the IPv6 templates were
developed, so this is technical debt that needs to be cleaned up.

Note that while there is not a dependency, this change is related
to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/322817/ which adds an IPv6
option for the Management network with automatically selected IPs.

Change-Id: I3d97a92439022fc8a55f3a53bb20779ca7cfdee4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/59/327259/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: 2015-10-15 description: > Returns an IP from a network mapped list of IPs. This version is for IPv6 addresses. The ip_address_uri output will have brackets for use in URLs. parameters: ManagementNetName: description: Name of the management network default: management type: string PortName: description: Name of the port default: '' type: string ControlPlaneIP: # Here for compatability with noop.yaml description: IP address on the control plane default: '' type: string IPPool: default: {} description: A network mapped list of IPs type: json NodeIndex: default: 0 description: Index of the IP to get from Pool type: number ManagementNetCidr: default: 'fd00:fd00:fd00:6000::/64' description: Cidr for the management network. type: string outputs: ip_address: description: Management network IP value: {get_param: [IPPool, {get_param: ManagementNetName}, {get_param: NodeIndex}]} ip_address_uri: description: Management network IP (for compatibility with management_v6.yaml) value: list_join: - '' - - '[' - {get_param: [IPPool, {get_param: ManagementNetName}, {get_param: NodeIndex}]} - ']' ip_subnet: description: IP/Subnet CIDR for the management network IP value: list_join: - '' - - {get_param: [IPPool, {get_param: ManagementNetName}, {get_param: NodeIndex}]} - '/' - {str_split: ['/', {get_attr: [ManagementPort, subnets, 0, cidr]}, 1]}

commit_message:
Adds methods in version.py for proper oslo_reports setup

The current implementation not provide useful information, such as a version
info to Guru Meditation report. This fix adds additional methods to version.py
that provide general information about used octavia package.

Change-Id: If546c4f737bcdd5575f57805762480bdcd590064
Closes-Bug: #1589858
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/85/325385/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OCTAVIA_VENDOR = "OpenStack Foundation" OCTAVIA_PRODUCT = "OpenStack Octavia" def vendor_string(): return OCTAVIA_VENDOR def product_string(): return OCTAVIA_PRODUCT def version_string_with_package(): return version_info.version_string()
